sen.j: 木村竹香（きむら ちっこう、男性、明治元年（1868年） - 昭和18年（1943年 1月28日））は、近代日本の篆刻家である。
sen.e: Chikko KIMURA (male 1868-January 28, 1943) is a Tenkoku artist (artist of seal engraving) in modern times of Japan.
Chikko KIMURA (male 1868-January 28, 1943) was a Tenkoku artist (artist of seal engraving) in modern times of Japan.
Chikko KIMURA (male 1868-January 28, 1943) was a Tenkoku artist (artist of seal engraving) in modern times of Japan.

sen.j: 篆刻界で有名な『羅漢印譜』を編集・刊行したことで知られる。
sen.e: He is known as a person who edited and published "Rakan Inpu" that is famous in Japanese tenkoku world.
sen.cmt: 羅漢印譜→Rakan Inpu (羅漢印譜) ［定訳不明：該当する読み方を見つけることができませんでした］
sen.e: He is known as a person who edited and published "Rakan Inpu" that is famous in Japanese tenkoku world.
He is known as a person who edited and published "Rakan Inpu" that is famous in Japanese tenkoku world.

sen.j: 名は政平、竹香は号 (称号)で斎号に酔古堂がある。
sen.e: His real first name is Shohei, Chikko is Go (second name or alias) and his Saigo (Go named after his reading room)is Suikodo.
sen.cmt: 政平→Shohei (政平) ［定訳不明：該当する読み方を見つけることができませんでした］酔古堂→Suikodo (酔古堂) ［定訳不明：該当する読み方を見つけることができませんでした］
sen.e: His real first name is Masahira, Chikko is Go (second name or alias) and his Saigo (Go named after his reading room)is Suikodo.
sen.cmt: 政平は「まさひら」ではないかと思います。変更しました。
sen.e: His real first name is Masahira, Chikko is Go (second name or alias) and his Saigo (Go named after his reading room)is Suikodo.

sen.j: 新潟県新潟市の人。
sen.e: He was born at Niigata City, Niigata Prefecture.
He was born at Niigata City, Niigata Prefecture.
He was born at Niigata City, Niigata Prefecture.

sen.j: 山田正平の実父。
sen.e: He is a biological father of Shohei YAMADA.
sen.cmt: 山田正平→Yamada Shohei (山田正平) ［国立国会図書館蔵書検索システムNDL-OPAC http://opac.ndl.go.jp/］
sen.e: He is a biological father of Shohei YAMADA.
He is a biological father of Shohei YAMADA.

sen.j: 略伝
sen.e: Brief Biography
Brief Biography
Brief Biography

sen.j: 白根市の生まれ。
sen.e: He was born at Shirone City.
He was born at Shirone City.
He was born at Shirone City.

sen.j: はじめ名工大江萬里の門戸を叩いたが断られ、そのまま東京に赴いて中井敬所の門人となる。
sen.e: At first, he visited a famous craftsman Banri OE but he was refused, and he went to Tokyo to become an apparentice of Keisho NAKAI.
sen.cmt: 大江萬里→Banri OE (大江萬里) ［定訳不明：該当する読み方を見つけることができませんでした］
sen.e: At first, he visited a famous craftsman Banri OE but he was refused, and he went to Tokyo to become an apparentice of Keisho NAKAI.
At first, he visited a famous craftsman Banri OE but he was refused, and he went to Tokyo to become an apparentice of Keisho NAKAI.

sen.j: 一年程修行し、敬所に香の一字を許されて竹香と号する。
sen.e: He served his apprenticeship for a year and was permitted by NAKAI to use a word "香" to call himself "竹香" as his Go.
He served his apprenticeship for a year and was permitted by NAKAI to use a word "香" to call himself "竹香" as his Go.
He served his apprenticeship for a year and was permitted by NAKAI to use a word "香" to call himself "竹香" as his Go.

sen.j: 新潟に帰り萬里の真向いの古町通りで開業。
sen.e: He returned to Niigata and opened his business in front of OE's house on the Furumachi-dori Street.
sen.cmt: 古町通り→Furumachi-dori Street (古町通り) ［定訳不明：新潟市中心部の古町通りのことかと思われますが確定できませんでした］
sen.e: He returned to Niigata and opened his business in front of OE's house on the Furumachi-dori Street.
He returned to Niigata and opened his business in front of OE's house on the Furumachi-dori Street.

sen.j: 版木屋を営む。
sen.e: He run a printblock shop.
He run a printblock shop.
He run a printblock shop.

sen.j: その篆刻技術の高さに萬里は舌を巻いたという。
sen.e: OE was amazed at his skill of Tenkoku.
OE was amazed at his skill of Tenkoku.
OE was amazed at his skill of Tenkoku.

sen.j: 妻はマス。
sen.e: The name of his wife is Masu.
The name of his wife is Masu.
The name of his wife is Masu.

sen.j: 漢詩もよくし、骨董趣味に高じた。
sen.e: He was also fond of creating Chinese poetry and keen on collecting antiques.
He was also fond of creating Chinese poetry and keen on collecting antiques.
He was also fond of creating Chinese poetry and keen on collecting antiques.

sen.j: あるとき、人の借金の保証から家財を没収され、蒐集した骨董品すべてを失ってしまった。
sen.e: In a day, his belongings were confisticated for the reason that he was a guarantor, and all his collections were taken away.
One day, his belongings were confiscated for the reason that he was a guarantor, and all his collections were taken away.
sen.cmt: in a day → one dayconfisticated → confiscated
sen.e: One day, his belongings were confiscated for the reason that he was a guarantor, and all his collections were taken away.

sen.j: 会津八一に気に入られて親交が深い。
sen.e: Favored by Yaichi AIZU, he built a close relationship with him.
Favored by Yaichi AIZU, he built a close relationship with him.
Favored by Yaichi AIZU, he built a close relationship with him.

sen.j: 山田寒山とは同郷で親交が深く、十六羅漢の印の制作を依頼している。
sen.e: He also formed a deep relationship with his countryman Kanzan YAMADA and he asked YAMADA to engrave a seal of Juroku Rakan.
He also formed a deep relationship with his countryman Kanzan YAMADA and he asked YAMADA to engrave a seal of Juroku Rakan.
He also formed a deep relationship with his countryman Kanzan YAMADA and he asked YAMADA to engrave a seal of Juroku Rakan.

sen.j: この十六羅漢は陶土で作成され、紫檀の箱に入れその扉に五世浜村蔵六の書した「金石結縁 瓦礫放光」の文字を竹香が刻んだ。
sen.e: This Juroku Rakan was made of clay and was put into a rosewood box, in the part to open of which Chikko engraved the character "金石結縁 瓦礫放光" written by Zoroku HAMAMURA (fifth).
This Juroku Rakan was made of clay and was put into a rosewood box, Chikko engraved the character "金石結縁 瓦礫放光" written by Zoroku HAMAMURA (fifth) on the opening of the box.
sen.cmt: in the part to open of which → on the opening of the box
sen.e: This Juroku Rakan was made of clay and was put into a rosewood box, Chikko engraved the character "金石結縁 瓦礫放光" written by Zoroku HAMAMURA (fifth) on the opening of the box.

sen.j: 巡錫中の永平寺監院星見天海が開眼を行うことになり大評判となった。
sen.e: The kaigan ceremony was to be held by Kanin of Eihei-ji Temple Tenkai HOSHIMI who was walking to preach through the country, which attracted huge popularity.
sen.cmt: 監院→Kanin (監院) ［定訳不明］開眼→Kaigan (開眼) ［定訳不明］
sen.e: The kaigan (eye-opening) inauguration ceremony was to be held by Kanin of Eihei-ji Temple Tenkai HOSHIMI who was on the tour to preach through the country, which attracted huge popularity.
sen.cmt: kaigan ceremony → kaigan (eye-opening) inauguration ceremonywalking → on the tour
sen.e: The kaigan (eye-opening) inauguration ceremony was to be held by Kanin of Eihei-ji Temple Tenkai HOSHIMI who was on the tour to preach through the country, which attracted huge popularity.

sen.j: 次男の山田正平は寒山の娘婿となり、東京に出る。
sen.e: His second son Shohei YAMADA became Kansan's son-in-law and moved to Tokyo.
sen.cmt: 山田正平→Shohei YAMADA （山田正平） ［定訳不明：該当する読み方を見つけることができませんでした］
sen.e: His second son Shohei YAMADA became Kanzan's son-in-law and moved to Tokyo.
His second son Shohei YAMADA became Kanzan's son-in-law and moved to Tokyo.

sen.j: 長男軍平と三男幸平は北洋漁業に従事して函館に移住していた。
sen.e: His eldest son Gunpei and his third son Kohei had moved to Hakodate to engage in fishing in northern Japan.
sen.cmt: 軍平→Gunpei (軍平) ［定訳不明：該当する読み方を見つけることができませんでした］幸平→Kohei (幸平) ［定訳不明：該当する読み方を見つけることができませんでした］
sen.e: His eldest son Gunpei and his third son Kohei had moved to Hakodate to engage in fishing in northern Japan.
His eldest son Gunpei and his third son Kohei had moved to Hakodate to engage in fishing in northern Japan.

sen.j: ひとり暮らしを心配した息子達に呼ばれて函館に移住した。
sen.e: His sons worried about his single life called him and he move to Hakodate.
His sons worried about his single life and asked him to live together, and then he moved to Hakodate.
sen.cmt: called him → and asked him to live together,move → moved
sen.e: His sons worried about his single life and asked him to live together, and then he moved to Hakodate.

sen.j: しかし、長年住んだ故郷が忘れられずに帰郷し回向院（新潟県新潟市西区）の副住職となる。
sen.e: However, he was gripped by nostalgia for his hometown where he had lived long, and returned to Niigata to become vice priest of Eco-in Temple (Nishi Ward, Niigata City, Niigata Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 回向院→ Eco-in Temple (回向院) ［定訳不明：該当する読み方を見つけることができませんでした］
sen.e: However, he was gripped by nostalgia for his hometown where he had lived long, and returned to Niigata to become vice priest of Eco-in Temple (Nishi Ward, Niigata City, Niigata Prefecture).
However, he was gripped by nostalgia for his hometown where he had lived long, and returned to Niigata to become vice priest of Eco-in Temple (Nishi Ward, Niigata City, Niigata Prefecture).

sen.j: 昭和11年、古希を迎えると自らの葬式代わりに寿筵を催した。
sen.e: In 1936, he organized Jyuen in his Koki (the cerebration of a person's 70th birthday) in stead of the funeral when he dies.
In 1936, he organized Jyuen (cerebration party of longevity) in his Koki (the cerebration of a person's 70th birthday) in substitution for his funeral in the future.
sen.cmt: (cerebration party of longevity)を追加しました。in stead of the funeral when he dies → in substitution for his funeral in the future
sen.e: In 1936, he organized Jyuen (cerebration party of longevity) in his Koki (the cerebration of a person's 70th birthday) in substitution for his funeral in the future.

sen.j: その後、再度北海道に渡り昭和18年に没した。
sen.e: After that, he moved to Hokkaido again and died in 1943.
After that, he moved to Hokkaido again and died in 1943.
After that, he moved to Hokkaido again and died in 1943.

sen.j: 享年77。
sen.e: His age at death is 77.
He died at the age of 77.
He died at the age of 77.
